course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Business Modeling with VBA
course.description: This course introduces students to business application modeling using Visual Basic Applications (VBA) in Excel. Students will learn to develop applications in different business areas, including finance, marketing, technology operations, etc. Essential features of VBA needed for application development will be introduced as part of the course and hence no prior experience with VBA is needed. Emphasis is on extensive hands-on problem solving.

reviews.author: LoganShen
reviews.comment_content: This course is designed to train students to model business problems logically and develop programming solutions to them using Visual Basic for Applications (VBA). Several business areas are covered in this course, for example, financial modeling, stock analysis, etc.Essential features of VBA needed for application development will be introduced as part of the course and hence no prior experience with VBA is needed.  Emphasis is on extensive hands-on problem solving. Prior experience with Excel is recommended but not mandatory.The first four sessions of the course will introduce students to VBA. Students will gainhands-on experience working on small business problems to reinforce the concepts learnt during lecture. For students who already have some experience with VBA this could be considered as a refresher. The next threesessions of the course will involve students implementing several business applications andmodels using VBA. Students will submit a final project (working in groups of 2 or alone) of their choiceand present their projects in the last class.
reviews.comment_teaching: The first 4 lectures will cover the major part of the basic function of VBA including Macro, for loop, if function, and so on. But the following lectures are not so valuable.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 lab assignment + 1 final project based on VBA
Without final exam
